Hello, Thank you for your question. I am sorry to hear about your nephew's diagnosis of sarcoidosis. There is no cure for this condition, but there are many effective treatment options. I would recommend discussing with his pulmonologist the possibility of adding methotrexate to his treatment regimen. Methotrexate is an immunosuppressant and is very effective in controlling symptoms of sarcoidosis. Methotrexate can be taken orally or by injection. Other treatment options may include prednisone, azathioprine, or cyclophosphamide. I would recommend discussing with his pulmonologist the possibility of adding one of these medications to his current treatment regimen. Regarding a heart/lung transplant, this is a very serious and invasive procedure and should not be considered until all other treatment options have been exhausted. I hope this helps. Best wishes, K

Hello and welcome to Khpaltabib, Veltam 0.4 mg is used for the treatment of benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH). It contains tamsulosin which is a type of alpha-blocker that relaxes the muscles of the prostate and bladder neck to reduce the pressure on the urethra. It is available in the form of capsules and is taken orally. It is not recommended for young males as it can decrease the sperm count. The common side effects of the medicine include headache, dizziness, fatigue, and sexual dysfunction. It is not known if it has any effect on semen count. I hope this information helps you,

Hello, Thanks for choosing Khpaltabib for posting your query. I have gone through your question in detail and I can understand what you are going through. Pancreatic cancer is one of the most aggressive cancers and is associated with very poor survival. The median survival of 5 years is not an accurate estimation of survival. In fact, 50% of patients will be dead in 1 year and 90% will be dead in 2 years. So, it is very difficult to predict survival in pancreatic cancer. The 6 months survival you have been told is just an estimate. In fact, it is very difficult to estimate the survival of patients with pancreatic cancer. The chemotherapy and radiotherapy is not done to prolong the life of the patient, but to control the symptoms and to improve the quality of life. I hope my answer helps. Hi Rajendra, Psoriasis is a chronic inflammatory skin condition. The cause of psoriasis is not known, but it is thought to be related to immune system dysfunction. Psoriasis is a long-lasting (chronic) skin disease that causes scaling and inflammation. It mainly affects the outside of elbows, knees, scalp, and lower back, but it can also occur on the face, palms, and soles. Psoriasis is a common skin condition that causes red, itchy patches of skin. It is thought to be caused by a problem with the immune system. It is not contagious. Psoriasis is not curable, but it can be treated. There are many treatments available, including creams, ointments, oral medications, and light therapy. The best treatment for you will depend on the severity of your psoriasis. I suggest you visit a dermatologist for a proper diagnosis and treatment. Thanks and take care K

Hello, Welcome to Khpaltabib, Kidney stones are the most common disorder of the urinary tract. It is a condition in which a solid piece of material (stone) forms in the urinary tract. The urinary tract includes the kidneys, ureters, bladder and urethra. Stones in the kidney or ureter (renal or ureteral stones) are the most common type of stones. Stones in the bladder (cyststones) are the most common type of stones. Stones in the urethra (urethral stones) are the least common type of stones. The most common symptom of kidney stones is pain, usually in the lower back, abdomen, groin or genitals. The pain of a kidney stone is often severe and is called renal colic. Other symptoms of kidney stones include frequent urination, blood in the urine, nausea and vomiting, painful urination and frequent urination at night. If a stone is blocking the flow of urine from the kidney, a person may experience pain and pressure in the abdomen. The treatment depends on the size of the stone, where it is located and whether it is causing problems. A small stone may pass on its own without treatment. A large stone may need to be removed with surgery or treated with medications or shock waves. If a stone is blocking the flow of urine from the kidney, a person may need to have a procedure called a stent placed in the ureter to keep the ureter open. A stent is a small tube that is inserted into the ureter through a catheter. The stent will stay in place until the stone is small enough to pass. I hope this answers your question. If you have additional questions or follow-up questions then please do not hesitate in writing to us. I will be happy to answer your questions. Wishing you g

Hello Firoz, I am glad to know that you have achieved a normal life style. Achalasia is a disease where the esophagus is not able to relax to allow food to pass through. This is a progressive disease and eventually leads to malnutrition and weight loss. There are a few surgical options but the best treatment is a Botox injection into the muscle of the lower esophagus. This is a very safe procedure which has been used for over 20 years. It is a simple procedure done in the doctors office and is covered by insurance. You can discuss this with your doctor. I hope

Hi, Welcome to Khpaltabib, The symptoms and signs are suggestive of Herpes Zoster, which is a viral infection. It is a viral infection which is caused by reactivation of the Varicella Zoster virus. The virus is present in the nerve roots and gets reactivated in the nerve roots. It is a very common condition, and it is a benign condition. It is a self-limited condition, and it will subside by itself. I would suggest you to take acyclovir 800 mg thrice a day for 7 days. You can take analgesics like Ibuprofen 400 mg thrice a day for pain. I would suggest you to take acyclovir for 7 days. Hope this helps ou

Hi... Thank you for consulting in Khpaltabib. By what you quote it seems your kid is having constipation. Constipation is a common problem in child Khpaltabib.  Unless the child is having a lot of hard stools or blood in motion or excessively sleepy or feeding very less or urinating very less, I usually do not worry about constipation. Constipation is a diagnosis of rule out and not rule in. Constipation is mostly due to -1.  Lack of fiber in diet2.  Constipating food like ice creams3.  Constantly using laxatives4.  Holding stools too long. So my advice is -1.  Give high fiber diet like fruits, vegetables, salads, wheat, etc.2.  Avoid constipating food.3.  Avoid use of laxatives.4.  If required, use stool softeners like Colace or lactulose.5.  Avoid use of enemas unless really required.  I hope my answer will help you.  I can be contacted at the following l

Hello! Welcome and thank you for asking on Khpaltabib! I understand your concern and would explain that your symptoms could be related to an anxiety disorder. You should know that anxiety disorders are characterized by physical symptoms that could resemble physical diseases. You should know that these symptoms are not related to a low potassium level. I would recommend consulting with your doctor and performing some tests: - a resting ECG- complete blood count- thyroid hormone levels- blood electrolytes-complete blood count- kidney and liver function tests- a chest X-ray study. An ambulatory 24-48 hours ECG monitoring is necessary in order to exclude any cardiac arrhythmia. A psychiatric evaluation is also necessary for a proper diagnosis and treatment. Psychotherapy (cognitive-behavioral therapy) and antidepressant medications (paroxetine, venlafaxine, mirtazapine, bupropion, etc.) would be the treatment of choice. Hope to have been helpful! Be
